intro: Arctotis sericea, commonly known as the silky arctotis, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features slender, hairy stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine, silvery hairs. Its showy flowers, which range from yellow to orange, bloom in late summer and early autumn. Arctotis sericea is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and is adapted to full sun and well-drained soils.
